cab.content: 11 o(THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY 'S GOVERNMENT).SECRET. COPY NO:4CP. 118 (28).CABINET.ARIviS FOR IBN SAOD.Note by tho Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs,(Reference Cabinet 20 (23) Conclusion 6).In accordance with the decision taken by the Cabinet on the 4th April, I enquired of Sir G. Clayton whether he adhered to the opinion e:rressed by him on the 9th March that his utility as a negotiator would be seriously prejudiced by any decision to hold up in this country the munitions already ordered by Ibn. Saud. He has informed me that he Is definitely of the same opinion.In these circumstances, I have instructed the Foreign Office to Inform the other Government Departments concerned that in my opinion the Cabinet decision should be given effect to forthwith and the munitions allowed to proceed on the understanding that the ehip called at Port Sudan, when, in case of need, the munitions can be held up,A . C aForeign Office, S ,Vv .1. April 5th,, 1928.
